step1.sentence: We had a ball at the festival — the food, the music, and the crowd were all perfect.

step2.story: The kids had a ball at the science museum, running from exhibit to exhibit and pressing every button they were allowed to press — and a few they were not.

step3.story: Nobody expected the office holiday party to be memorable. Last year's had been stiff and awkward in a rented conference room with warm wine and a DJ nobody had asked for. This year, someone on the planning committee booked a rooftop venue, hired a local jazz trio, and organized a competitive cooking challenge instead of a sit-down dinner. People who had never spoken to each other outside of meetings were laughing and plating food together by eight. Everyone agreed they had a ball, and the planning committee was already getting requests about next year before midnight.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 행사나 경험을 매우 즐겁고 신나게 보낼 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: grand ball이라는 화려한 무도회에서 유래했으며, 즐거운 사교 행사의 이미지를 담고 있습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 들뜬 감정을 강하게 표현하는 구어 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We had a ball at the reunion — it was so good to see everyone.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 동창회에서 정말 신나게 즐겼어요 — 다들 반가웠어요.
